column1: Efficient Online Learning for Mapping Kernels on Linguistic Structures
Giovanni Da San Martino@Qatar Computing Research Institute
Kernel methods are popular and effective techniques for learning on structured data
column2: such as trees and graphs. One of their major drawbacks is the computational cost related to making a prediction on an example
column3: which manifests in the classification phase for batch kernel methods
column4: and especially in online learning algorithms. In this paper
column5: we analyze how to speed up the prediction when the kernel function is an instance of the Mapping Kernels
column6: a general framework for specifying kernels for structured data which extends the popular convolution kernel framework. We theoretically study the general model
column7: derive various optimization strategies and show how to apply them to popular kernels for structured data. Additionally
column8: we derive a reliable empirical evidence on semantic role labeling task
column9: which is a natural language classification task
column10: highly dependent on syntactic trees. The results show that our faster approach can clearly improve on standard kernel-based SVMs
column11: which cannot run on very large datasets.
